glsa.title: CVS: Heap-based overflow
glsa.synopsis: A heap-based buffer overflow in CVS might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: CVS (Concurrent Versions System) is an open-source network-transparent version control system. It contains both a client utility and a server.

description.p: A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in the proxy_connect function in src/client.c in CVS.

impact.p: An attacker, utilizing a remote HTTP proxy server, could cause a Denial of Service condition or possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted HTTP response.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All CVS users should upgrade to the latest version:
